newsitem.title: JAPAN: Key 182nd JGB yield dips to record low 2.100 pct.
newsitem.headline: Key 182nd JGB yield dips to record low 2.100 pct.

text.p: The yield of the benchmark three percent 182nd 10-year Japanese government bond (JGB) fell further to a record low of 2.100 percent on Monday afternoon.
The yield ended at 2.120 percent on Friday in Tokyo.
Traders said a rally in the bond's price was spearheaded by short-covering by traders and better-than-expected sales of newly launched corporate bonds to end-investors.
Some investment trust funds, however, bought cash put options, suggesting they take the view that the JGB market is approaching a ceiling, they said.
About 250 billion yen worth of corporate straight bonds were launched on Monday, which had been expected to depress the JGBs.
